title: Snake (monster class)
data:
- *For the monster, see [Snake](/wiki/Snake "Snake").*

The **snake** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [S](/wiki/S "S") glyph (S). Snakes are designated internally by the macro `S_SNAKE`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- S [garter snake](/wiki/Garter_snake "Garter snake")
- S [snake](/wiki/Snake "Snake")
- S [water moccasin](/wiki/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin")
- S [pit viper](/wiki/Pit_viper "Pit viper")
- S [python](/wiki/Python "Python")
- S [cobra](/wiki/Cobra "Cobra")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Body parts](#Body_parts)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Common traits

Snakes are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") [animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that are [slithy](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy") and naturally have no [limbs](/wiki/Limb "Limb"). Snakes are capable of [hiding](/wiki/Hiding "Hiding") under [items](/wiki/Item "Item") on the ground, with the exception of the python - they are also generally [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison"), except for the python and garter snake.

[Tridents](/wiki/Trident "Trident") have a +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus against snakes that are not currently in water.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Playing a [wooden flute](/wiki/Wooden_flute "Wooden flute") has a a chance of pacifying nearby snakes based on dexterity and [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") - the effect occurs when the sum of your character's experience level and the roll of a dexterity-sized die is equal to or greater than 27.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

### Generation

Randomly generated snake monsters are always created hostile with the exception of the garter snake, which may generate as peaceful for neutral characters.

The clerical [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") will generate snakes if all [insects](/wiki/Insect "Insect") are [extinct](/wiki/Extinct "Extinct") or [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

The snake monster class is the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"): the monster class also occupies the slot typically designated for the first quest monster, and so makes up 24⁄35 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest"). Several snakes are also generated on each level of the quest branch at level creation: eleven random snakes are generated on the home level, with eight stationed near the entrance of the college; six are generated on the upper filler level; three are generated on the lower filler level(s); and eighteen are generated on the locate and goal levels.

[Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") generates some snakes at level creation for certain maps: the first variant places a random snake in each of the hallways within Medusa's dwelling on the center isle, while the fourth variant generates 14 random snakes around the level.

Snakes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, even if they are do not actually have the ability to hide as with pythons.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Body parts

**Snake** also refers to the grouping of body parts for the forms of snakes and [nagas](/wiki/Naga "Naga"), with the following words and phrases in messages referring to body parts exchanged as follows:[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

| Body part[\[9\]](#cite_note-9) | Description     |
| ------------------------------ | --------------- |
| Arm                            | Vestigial limb  |
| Eye                            | Eye             |
| Face                           | Face            |
| Finger                         | Large scale     |
| Fingertip                      | Large scale tip |
| Foot                           | Rear region     |
| Hand                           | Scale gap       |
| Handed                         | Scale gapped    |
| Head                           | Head            |
| Leg                            | Rear region     |
| Light headed                   | Light headed    |
| Neck                           | Neck            |
| Spine                          | Length          |
| Toe                            | Rear scale      |
| Hair                           | Scales          |
| Blood                          | Blood           |
| Lung                           | Lung            |
| Nose                           | Forked tongue   |
| Stomach                        | Stomach         |

## History

The snake first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). The other snakes are introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Snake](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake "wikipedia:Snake")***

Snakes are elongated, limbless, carnivorous reptiles of the suborder *Serpentes* that are ectothermic and amniote vertebrates covered in overlapping scales. Many species of snakes have skulls with several more joints than their lizard ancestors, enabling them to swallow prey much larger than their heads. Snakes are thought to have evolved from either burrowing or aquatic lizards, perhaps during the Jurassic period, with the earliest known fossils dating to between 143 and 167 million years ago; some species retain a pelvic girdle with a pair of vestigial claws on either side. There are at least twenty-five forms of "legless lizard" that resemble snakes as a result of independently evolving elongate bodies with limbs that are either greatly reduced or nonexistent; several common groups of legless lizards still have eyelids and external ears, which snakes lack.

Living snakes are found on every continent except Antarctica, and on most smaller land masses with the exception of some large islands, such as Ireland, Iceland and, as well as many small islands of the Atlantic and central Pacific oceans. Around thirty families are currently recognized, comprising about 520 genera and about 3,900 species - the oldest preserved descriptions of snakes can be found in the [Brooklyn Papyrus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brooklyn_Papyrus "wikipedia:Brooklyn Papyrus"). Most species of snake are nonvenomous and those that have venom use it primarily to kill and subdue prey rather than for self-defense; some snakes have venom potent enough to cause painful injury or death to humans.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds some new monsters to the snake monster class:

- S [king cobra](/wiki/King_cobra "King cobra")
- @ / S [weresnake](/wiki/Weresnake "Weresnake")
- S [asphynx](/wiki/Asphynx "Asphynx")

The Snake Pit of the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") contains two to four random snakes at level creation.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds many new monsters to the monster class:

- S [wraithworm](/index.php?title=Wraithworm\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wraithworm (page does not exist)")
- S [serpent man of Yoth](/index.php?title=Serpent_man_of_Yoth\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Serpent man of Yoth (page does not exist)")
- S [daughter of Naunet](/index.php?title=Daughter_of_Naunet\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Daughter of Naunet (page does not exist)")
- S [man-serpent soldier](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_soldier\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent soldier (page does not exist)")
- S [man-serpent mage](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_mage\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent mage (page does not exist)")
- S [man-serpent summoner](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_summoner\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent summoner (page does not exist)")
- S [man-serpent giant](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_giant\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent giant (page does not exist)")
- S [pisaca](/index.php?title=Pisaca\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pisaca (page does not exist)")
- S [first wraithworm](/index.php?title=First_wraithworm\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "First wraithworm (page does not exist)")

The Paradise Island map of [The Sea](/wiki/The_Sea_\(dNetHack\) "The Sea (dNetHack)") will generate three random snakes at level creation.

The [Cartouche of the Cat Lord](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Cartouche_of_the_Cat_Lord "User:Chris/dNetHack/Cartouche of the Cat Lord") and [The Wings of Garuda](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/The_Wings_of_Garuda "User:Chris/dNetHack/The Wings of Garuda") are [wards](/wiki/Ward_\(dNetHack\) "Ward (dNetHack)") that can scare off snakes.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds one new monster to the monster class:

- S [giant anaconda](/wiki/Giant_anaconda "Giant anaconda")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 59](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L59)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1749](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L1749)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 163](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/weapon.c#L163)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 122](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L122): *`charm_snakes`*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 574](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L574): *Wooden flute effects*
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 589](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mcastu.c#L589)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1243](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1243): *snakes get a free house*
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1659](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L1659)
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [include/hack.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 409](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/hack.h#L409)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Snake (monster class)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the monster, see Snake.

The snake is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the uppercase S glyph (S). Snakes are designated internally by the macro S_SNAKE.[1]

The monster class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • S garter snake
  • S snake
  • S water moccasin
  • S pit viper
  • S python
  • S cobra

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 Body parts
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 dNetHack
    • 5.3 EvilHack
  • 6 References

Common traits

Snakes are neutral-aligned carnivorous and oviparous animals that are slithy and naturally have no limbs. Snakes are capable of hiding under items on the ground, with the exception of the python - they are also generally poisonous, except for the python and garter snake.

Tridents have a +2 to-hit bonus against snakes that are not currently in water.[3]

Playing a wooden flute has a a chance of pacifying nearby snakes based on dexterity and experience level - the effect occurs when the sum of your character's experience level and the roll of a dexterity-sized die is equal to or greater than 27.[4][5]

Generation

Randomly generated snake monsters are always created hostile with the exception of the garter snake, which may generate as peaceful for neutral characters.

The clerical monster spell summon insects will generate snakes if all insects are extinct or genocided.[6]

The snake monster class is the first quest monster class for Archeologists: the monster class also occupies the slot typically designated for the first quest monster, and so makes up 24⁄35 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Archeologist quest. Several snakes are also generated on each level of the quest branch at level creation: eleven random snakes are generated on the home level, with eight stationed near the entrance of the college; six are generated on the upper filler level; three are generated on the lower filler level(s); and eighteen are generated on the locate and goal levels.

Medusa's Island generates some snakes at level creation for certain maps: the first variant places a random snake in each of the hallways within Medusa's dwelling on the center isle, while the fourth variant generates 14 random snakes around the level.

Snakes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, even if they are do not actually have the ability to hide as with pythons.[7]

Body parts

Snake also refers to the grouping of body parts for the forms of snakes and nagas, with the following words and phrases in messages referring to body parts exchanged as follows:[8]

Body part[9] Description
Arm Vestigial limb
Eye Eye
Face Face
Finger Large scale
Fingertip Large scale tip
Foot Rear region
Hand Scale gap
Handed Scale gapped
Head Head
Leg Rear region
Light headed Light headed
Neck Neck
Spine Length
Toe Rear scale
Hair Scales
Blood Blood
Lung Lung
Nose Forked tongue
Stomach Stomach

History

The snake first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial bestiary for Hack 1.0. The other snakes are introduced in NetHack 3.0.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Snake

Snakes are elongated, limbless, carnivorous reptiles of the suborder Serpentes that are ectothermic and amniote vertebrates covered in overlapping scales. Many species of snakes have skulls with several more joints than their lizard ancestors, enabling them to swallow prey much larger than their heads. Snakes are thought to have evolved from either burrowing or aquatic lizards, perhaps during the Jurassic period, with the earliest known fossils dating to between 143 and 167 million years ago; some species retain a pelvic girdle with a pair of vestigial claws on either side. There are at least twenty-five forms of "legless lizard" that resemble snakes as a result of independently evolving elongate bodies with limbs that are either greatly reduced or nonexistent; several common groups of legless lizards still have eyelids and external ears, which snakes lack.

Living snakes are found on every continent except Antarctica, and on most smaller land masses with the exception of some large islands, such as Ireland, Iceland and, as well as many small islands of the Atlantic and central Pacific oceans. Around thirty families are currently recognized, comprising about 520 genera and about 3,900 species - the oldest preserved descriptions of snakes can be found in the Brooklyn Papyrus. Most species of snake are nonvenomous and those that have venom use it primarily to kill and subdue prey rather than for self-defense; some snakes have venom potent enough to cause painful injury or death to humans.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds some new monsters to the snake monster class:

  • S king cobra
  • @ / S weresnake
  • S asphynx

The Snake Pit of the Lawful Quest contains two to four random snakes at level creation.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds many new monsters to the monster class:

  • S wraithworm
  • S serpent man of Yoth
  • S daughter of Naunet
  • S man-serpent soldier
  • S man-serpent mage
  • S man-serpent summoner
  • S man-serpent giant
  • S pisaca
  • S first wraithworm

The Paradise Island map of The Sea will generate three random snakes at level creation.

The Cartouche of the Cat Lord and The Wings of Garuda are wards that can scare off snakes.

EvilHack

EvilHack adds one new monster to the monster class:

  • S giant anaconda

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 59
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1749
  3. ↑ src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 163
  4. ↑ src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 122: charm_snakes
  5. ↑ src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 574: Wooden flute effects
  6. ↑ src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 589
  7. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1243: snakes get a free house
  8. ↑ src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1659
  9. ↑ include/hack.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 409

rawPage: {{otheruses||the monster|Snake}} The '''snake''' is a [[monster class]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'', and is represented by the uppercase [[S]] glyph ({{white|S}}). Snakes are designated internally by the macro '''S_SNAKE'''.{{refsrc|include/monsym.h|59|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} The monster class contains the following monsters:{{refsrc|src/monst.c|1749|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} * {{monsymlink|garter snake}} * {{monsymlink|snake}} * {{monsymlink|water moccasin}} * {{monsymlink|pit viper}} * {{monsymlink|python}} * {{monsymlink|cobra}} ==Common traits== Snakes are [[neutral]]-aligned [[carnivorous]] and [[oviparous]] [[animal]]s that are [[slithy]] and naturally have no [[limb]]s. Snakes are capable of [[hiding]] under [[item]]s on the ground, with the exception of the python - they are also generally [[poison]]ous, except for the python and garter snake. [[Trident]]s have a +2 [[to-hit]] bonus against snakes that are not currently in water.{{refsrc|src/weapon.c|163|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Playing a [[wooden flute]] has a a chance of pacifying nearby snakes based on dexterity and [[experience level]] - the effect occurs when the sum of your character's experience level and the roll of a dexterity-sized die is equal to or greater than 27.{{refsrc|src/music.c|122|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=charm_snakes}}{{refsrc|src/music.c|574|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Wooden flute effects}} ===Generation=== Randomly generated snake monsters are always created hostile with the exception of the garter snake, which may generate as peaceful for neutral characters. The clerical [[monster spell]] [[summon insects]] will generate snakes if all [[insect]]s are [[extinct]] or [[genocide]]d.{{refsrc|src/mcastu.c|589|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} The snake monster class is the first [[quest]] monster class for [[Archeologist]]s: the monster class also occupies the slot typically designated for the first quest monster, and so makes up {{frac|24|35}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Archeologist quest]]. Several snakes are also generated on each level of the quest branch at level creation: eleven random snakes are generated on the home level, with eight stationed near the entrance of the college; six are generated on the upper filler level; three are generated on the lower filler level(s); and eighteen are generated on the locate and goal levels. [[Medusa's Island]] generates some snakes at level creation for certain maps: the first variant places a random snake in each of the hallways within Medusa's dwelling on the center isle, while the fourth variant generates 14 random snakes around the level. Snakes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, even if they are do not actually have the ability to hide as with pythons.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1243|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=snakes get a free house}} ==Body parts== '''Snake''' also refers to the grouping of body parts for the forms of snakes and [[naga]]s, with the following words and phrases in messages referring to body parts exchanged as follows:{{refsrc|src/polyself.c|1659|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} {| class="prettytable" !Body part{{refsrc|include/hack.h|409|nethack=3.6.7}}!!Description |- |Arm||Vestigial limb |- |Eye||Eye |- |Face||Face |- |Finger||Large scale |- |Fingertip||Large scale tip |- |Foot||Rear region |- |Hand||Scale gap |- |Handed||Scale gapped |- |Head||Head |- |Leg||Rear region |- |Light headed||Light headed |- |Neck||Neck |- |Spine||Length |- |Toe||Rear scale |- |Hair||Scales |- |Blood||Blood |- |Lung||Lung |- |Nose||Forked tongue |- |Stomach||Stomach |} ==History== The snake first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial bestiary for [[Hack 1.0]]. The other snakes are introduced in [[NetHack 3.0.0]]. ==Origin== {{wikipedia|Snake}} Snakes are elongated, limbless, carnivorous reptiles of the suborder ''Serpentes'' that are ectothermic and amniote vertebrates covered in overlapping scales. Many species of snakes have skulls with several more joints than their lizard ancestors, enabling them to swallow prey much larger than their heads. Snakes are thought to have evolved from either burrowing or aquatic lizards, perhaps during the Jurassic period, with the earliest known fossils dating to between 143 and 167 million years ago; some species retain a pelvic girdle with a pair of vestigial claws on either side. There are at least twenty-five forms of "legless lizard" that resemble snakes as a result of independently evolving elongate bodies with limbs that are either greatly reduced or nonexistent; several common groups of legless lizards still have eyelids and external ears, which snakes lack. Living snakes are found on every continent except Antarctica, and on most smaller land masses with the exception of some large islands, such as Ireland, Iceland and, as well as many small islands of the Atlantic and central Pacific oceans. Around thirty families are currently recognized, comprising about 520 genera and about 3,900 species - the oldest preserved descriptions of snakes can be found in the [[Wikipedia:Brooklyn Papyrus|Brooklyn Papyrus]]. Most species of snake are nonvenomous and those that have venom use it primarily to kill and subdue prey rather than for self-defense; some snakes have venom potent enough to cause painful injury or death to humans. ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== [[SLASH'EM]] adds some new monsters to the snake monster class: * {{monsymlink|king cobra}} * {{monsymlink|weresnake}} * {{monsymlink|asphynx}} The Snake Pit of the [[Lawful Quest]] contains two to four random snakes at level creation. ===dNetHack=== [[dNetHack]] adds many new monsters to the monster class: * {{gray|S}} [[wraithworm]] * {{cyan|S}} [[serpent man of Yoth]] * {{black|S}} [[daughter of Naunet]] * {{brightgreen|S}} [[man-serpent soldier]] * {{brightblue|S}} [[man-serpent mage]] * {{brightcyan|S}} [[man-serpent summoner]] * {{orange|S}} [[man-serpent giant]] * {{brightblue|S}} [[pisaca]] * {{brightmagenta|S}} [[first wraithworm]] The Paradise Island map of [[The Sea (dNetHack)|The Sea]] will generate three random snakes at level creation. The [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Cartouche of the Cat Lord|Cartouche of the Cat Lord]] and [[User:Chris/dNetHack/The Wings of Garuda|The Wings of Garuda]] are [[Ward (dNetHack)|wards]] that can scare off snakes. ===EvilHack=== [[EvilHack]] adds one new monster to the monster class: * {{brightgreen|S}} [[giant anaconda]] ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Monster classes]] [[Category:Body parts]]
